Gennady likes strings very much. He likes to solve most problems involving strings. So this problem contains strings and strings only.
You will be given a string S with lower-case alphabets only. You have to count the number of substrings which start and end at the same character and has an odd length.


Input
First line contains a positive integer T denoting the number of test cases.
For each test case, a string S is provided without any spaces in a separate new line.


Output
For every T test cases, find the required answer.
Note:
Substring wiki: link.


Constraints:
1 ≤ T ≤ 5
1 ≤ |S| ≤ 10^6


Example
Input:
3
gennady
codecracker
aayush
Output:
7
13
6
